alert.note: Alert for El Paso (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 11 at 10:15PM MDT until May 12 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity for the following rivers in Colorado... Fountain Creek Near Fountain Creek near Fountain affecting El Paso County. Fountain Creek At Colorado Springs affecting El Paso County. For the Fountain Creek...including Colorado Springs, Fountain Creek near Fountain, Pinon, Pueblo...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Fountain Creek Near Fountain Creek near Fountain. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Moderate agricultural flooding and bank erosion occurs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 13.1 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.1 feet on 04/30/1999. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 1015 AM MDT.
